intro: Tragia mitis var. genuina, commonly known as the slender tragia, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, yellowish-green flowers. It typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in disturbed soils. The leaves are usually alternate and have a rough, hairy texture.
